{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# The Image Class\n",
    "This notebook introduces the image class and how to access the different elements"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import phenoscope as ps"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Loading in data\n",
    "\n",
    "Let's load in an image of a colony"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x800 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Load in a numpy array with the image data for a fungal colony at 12 hours\n",
    "test_image = ps.data.load_colony_12_hr()\n",
    "\n",
    "# Display the image\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(8, 8))\n",
    "plt.imshow(test_image)\n",
    "plt.title(\"Test Image\")\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Loading the Image into PhenoScope\n",
    "\n",
    "Now let's load this image into a PhenoScope `Image` object.\n",
    "\n",
    "> Note: \n",
    "    - Every Image object is assigned a UUID at creation. This is used for interacting with other image processing software\n",
    "    - When creating the class, if no name was given as input, the name is automatically set to the UUID. The name can be changed at any time however\n",
    "    - When visualizing image, if not title is provided to Image.show(), the title is defaulted to the name"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Image shape: (183, 166, 3)\n",
      "Image schema: RGB\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "(<Figure size 900x1000 with 1 Axes>,\n",
       " <Axes: title={'center': '8700956b-416d-445a-9a3b-42167d72f5d2'}>)"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 10,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 900x1000 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Create an Image object from the numpy array\n",
    "img = ps.Image(test_image, input_schema='RGB')\n",
    "print(f\"Image shape: {img.shape}\")\n",
    "print(f\"Image schema: {img.schema}\")\n",
    "img.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Accessing Image Componenent Elements\n",
    "In order to access the components of each image as an array, the components must be sliced. However, many helper functions were addded to mimic normal numpy array behavior as well."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Image Array: Type=<class 'phenoscope.core.accessors._image_array_accessor.ImageArray'>, Shape=(183, 166, 3)\n",
      "Image Array: Type=<class 'numpy.ndarray'>, Shape=(183, 166, 3)\n",
      "Image Array: Type=<class 'phenoscope.core.accessors._image_matrix_accessor.ImageMatrix'>, Shape=(183, 166)\n",
      "Image Matrix: Type=<class 'numpy.ndarray'>, Shape=(183, 166)\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "\n",
    "image_array = img.array # Without using a key to access elements the accessor object is returned\n",
    "print(f\"Image.array: Type={type(image_array)}, Shape={image_array.shape}\")\n",
    "\n",
    "image_array = img.array[:] # Using indexing instead of test_image.array\n",
    "print(f\"Image.array[:]: Type={type(image_array)}, Shape={image_array.shape}\")\n",
    "\n",
    "image_array = img.matrix # Without using a key to access elements the accessor object is returned\n",
    "print(f\"Image.matrix: Type={type(img.matrix)}, Shape={image_array.shape}\")\n",
    "\n",
    "image_matrix = img.matrix[:] # Using indexing insteead of test_image.matrix\n",
    "print(f\"Image Matrix: Type={type(image_matrix)}, Shape={image_matrix.shape}\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Streamlined Prototyping\n",
    "See your image faster"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x800 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, ax = img.show(figsize=(8,8))\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Array/Matrix Sync\n",
    "\n",
    "The Image class"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Mean RGB values: R=61.6, G=62.5, B=61.5\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x800 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    },
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Number of red pixels: 0\n",
      "Expected number of pixels: 2500\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Extract features from the image\n",
    "# For demonstration, we'll just get some basic statistics\n",
    "mean_values = np.mean(img.array[:], axis=(0, 1))\n",
    "print(f\"Mean RGB values: R={mean_values[0]:.1f}, G={mean_values[1]:.1f}, B={mean_values[2]:.1f}\")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Create a mask for the red square\n",
    "red_mask = img.array[:, :, 0] > 200\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(8, 8))\n",
    "plt.imshow(red_mask, cmap='gray')\n",
    "plt.title(\"Red Square Mask\")\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Conclusion\n",
    "\n",
    "This notebook demonstrated basic image loading and analysis with PhenoScope. For more advanced features, check out the other examples."
   ]
  }
